biogHist.abstract: Burnbrae Presbyterian Children's Home was established by the Council Presbyterian Children's Home in 1938, in Byford. Children who were wards of the state and private children were admitted, both boys and (from 1940) girls. Burnbrae accommodated children from under 6 years to secondary school age. Children were transferred to Benmore in Caversham when Burnbrae closed in December 1956.
biogHist.p: Burnbrae Presbyterian Children's Home was established by the Presbyterian Children's Homes Committee (later, Council) on a rural property in Byford.

In 1953, Burnbrae was described as being able to accommodate up to 52 children, including boys up to 10 years of age (older girls stayed at Burnbrae; it is possible that boys older than 10 were sent to Benmore in Caversham). Children went to the Burnbrae Primary School, Armadale High School and Perth College.
By December 1956, children and young people were transferred to Benmore, and Burnbrae closed.

chronItem.event: Address - Burnbrae Presbyterian Children's Home was situated on a large rural property east of State Forest Lot 22, Hills Road, Byford

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Western Australian Government Records relating to Child Welfare and Protection (1894 - )

descriptiveNote.p: Burnbrae - buildings and works, State Records Office of WA (1941 - 1967) includes a drawing of the location of the Burnbrae Home, Burnbrae Primary School and major roads (1954) and information about the disposal of the Burnbrae Home's buildings.

In his submission to the Inquiry into Children in Institutional Care, a man who lived at the Burnbrae Presbyterian Children's Home (1938 - 1956) remembered going for summer holiday camps at the WA School for Deaf Children in the 1940s.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Uniting Church Archives Children's Homes Database, Western Australia (1922? - 1980s)

descriptiveNote.p: People who were in Burnbrae are invited to make enquiries or raise concerns through UnitingCare West, which has inherited the history of Presbyterian child welfare agencies.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia) Archives, Records (1918 - 1980s)

descriptiveNote.p: The School Journal [Burnbrae Glen, Byford] (1941 - 1947) has information about the school-related activities undertaken by children at Burnbrae Presbyterian Children's Home. People who were in Burnbrae may remember some of the events summarised here, from remarks recorded in the journal.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Burnbrae (late Byford Presbyterian Children's Home) - attendance (1942 - 1964)

descriptiveNote.p: Burnbrae (late Byford Presbyterian Children's Home) - attendance (1942 - 1964) has information about the school-related activities undertaken by children at Burnbrae Presbyterian Children's Home. People who were in Burnbrae may remember some of the events summarised here, from remarks recorded in the journal.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Item 070 - School Journal, Burnbrae Glen, Byford (1948 - 1956)

descriptiveNote.p: The School Journal [Burnbrae Glen, Byford] has information about the school-related activities undertaken by children at Burnbrae Presbyterian Children's Home. People who were in Burnbrae may remember some of the events summarised here, from remarks recorded in the journal.
Benmore and Burnbrae were the two Homes run by the Council Presbyterian Children's Homes. By mid-1957, all the children from Burnbrae had been transferred to Benmore.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Dedication and Official Opening of Benmore

archref.repository: Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia) Uniting Church Children's Homes File, Western Australia Archives
archref.unittitle: Dedication and Official Opening of Benmore
archref.abstract: 'Dedication and Official Opening of Benmore' is a digital copy of the program printed for the opening of the Benmore Presbyterian Children's Home in 1947. It has images and history about the Benmore and Burnbrae Presbyterian Children's Homes, a plan of Benmore and a list of the Home's 'needs'. A photocopy of this program is held in the Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia) Archives.
archref.note: Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia), Archives

resourceRelation.relationEntry: The Children's Homes, 1953 [Presbyterian Children's Home Council, excerpt]

archref.repository: Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia) Uniting Church Children's Homes File, Western Australia Archives
archref.unittitle: The Children's Homes, 1953 [Presbyterian Children's Home Council, excerpt]
archref.abstract: 'The Children's Homes, 1953 [Presbyterian Children's Home Council, excerpt]' is a digital copy of an excerpt from a report given to the Presbyterian Church by the committee that ran the Burnbrae and Benmore Presbyterian Children's Homes. A photocopy of this report is held in the Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia) Archives.
archref.note: Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia), Archives

archref.repository: Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia) Uniting Church Children's Homes File, Western Australia Archives
archref.abstract: 'Report of Childrens Homes Committee, 1939 [excerpt]' is a digital copy of an exerpt from a report given to the Presbyterian Church by the committee established to develop and run children's Homes on behalf of the church in Western Australia. A photocopy of this report is held in the Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia) Archives.
archref.note: Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia), Archives

resourceRelation.relationEntry: John Moss C.B.E. U.K. Child Welfare Expert. Visit to Australia. Part II

archref.unittitle: John Moss C.B.E. U.K. Child Welfare Expert. Visit to Australia. Part II
archref.abstract: This is a file held online by the National Archives of Australia. It has draft reports on the Australian institutions which took unaccompanied British child migrants after World War Two.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Burnbrae Home and School location map, 1954

archref.repository: State Records Office of Western Australia
archref.unittitle: Burnbrae Home and School location map, 1954
archref.abstract: 'Burnbrae Home and School location map' is a digital photograph of a drawing made by Mr B. Downes, who was the Head Teacher of the Government School, Burnbrae. The drawing shows the relative location of the school, the Burnbrae Presbyterian Children's Home and nearby roads. The drawing is part of a building and works file created by the Education Department and held at the State Records Office of Western Australia.
This picture of Burnbrae Presbyterian Children's Home in Byford was used in the programme for the opening of a new Home (Benmore) in Caversham. It probably shows Burnbrae as it looked in 1947.

archref.repository: State Records Office of Western Australia
archref.abstract: This is a picture of the label that was glued inside the cover of a Burnbrae School Journal. The label has instructions about how to use the journal. The journal was the official record of events at the school so the Education Department tried to regulate the type of things that were written in it.

archref.repository: State Records Office of Western Australia
archref.abstract: This is a picture of the label that was glued inside the cover of a Burnbrae School Journal. The label has instructions about how to use the journal. The journal was the official record of events at the school so the Education Department tried to regulate the type of things that were written in it.

archref.repository: State Records Office of Western Australia
archref.abstract: This is a picture of the front cover of the Burnbrae School Journal. Journals like this were issued to all state schools by the Education Department in Western Australia. This journal can be seen in the State Records Office of Western Australia.
